summary: This document is a brief email or message from the Supervisory Chaplain at MCC Manhattan, forwarding a news article about whether Jeffrey Epstein will receive a Jewish burial despite his crimes. The message includes a quote from Rudyard Kipling.

persons.name: Supervisory Chaplain MCC Manhattan
persons.context: The sender of the message, who works at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in Manhattan and is forwarding a news article about Jeffrey Epstein's burial.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the forwarded news article, which discusses the possibility of him receiving a Jewish burial despite his criminal convictions.

persons.name: R. Kipling
persons.context: Referenced as the author of the quote included in the message signature: 'If you can trust yourself when all men doubt you, but make allowance for their doubting too'.

locations: MCC Manhattan, NY 150 Park Row New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A Supervisory Chaplain at MCC Manhattan forwarded a news article regarding Jeffrey Epstein's potential burial arrangements.
The article questions whether Jeffrey Epstein will receive a Jewish burial despite his crimes.
The message includes a philosophical quote from author Rudyard Kipling about trust and doubt.
